gameRecap.title: Game Recap: Pacers 140, Knicks 126
gameRecap.excerpt: Indiana wins their third game in a row as they defeat New York, 140-126, and improve to 17-14. Tyrese Haliburton led the Pacers with 22 points and a career-high 23 assists. The 23 assists tie the most in a game in franchise history (Jamaal Tinsley, 11.22.01 v WAS). Aaron Nesmith went for 25 points (career-high eight 3PT FG) as Myles Turner added 28 points (season-high six 3PT, eight rebounds) for Indiana. Donte DiVincenzo went for a career-high 38 points, along with six rebounds as Jalen Brunson (28 points, six assists) and Julius Randle (28 points, 12 rebounds, four assists) totaled 56 points. The Knicks move to 17-15.
